description: A derivative is a contract which derives its value from an underlying reference index, security or asset.
title: Derivative Schema

___balance.description: Outstanding amount including accrued interest. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___insolvency_rank.description: The insolvency ranking as per the national legal framework of the reporting institution.

___customer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the customer for this product.

___call_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be called (by the customer). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___implied_vol.description: Options: implied volatility used to compute mtm and greeks.

$eref.description: Is the data an asset, a liability, or equity on the firm's balance sheet?

___notional_amount.description: The notional value is the total value with regard to a derivative's underlying index, security or asset at its spot price in accordance with the specifications (i.e. leverage) of the derivative product. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___break_dates.description: Dates where this contract can be broken (by either party). Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___product_name.description: The name of the product as given by the financial institution to be used for display and reference purposes.

$eref.description: The type of portfolio in which the instrument is held.

___fvh_level.description: Fair value hierarchy category according to IFRS 13.93 (b)

$eref.description: The asset class to which the derivative belongs.

___rate.description: The full interest rate applied to the derivative notional in percentage terms. Note that this therefore includes the base_rate (ie. not the spread).

___cost_center_code.description: The organizational unit or sub-unit to which costs/profits are booked.

___base_rate.description: The base rate represents the basis of the rate on the balance at the given date as agreed in the terms of the financial product.

___initial_margin.description: Upfront margin posted/received for the trade. Monetary type as integer number of cents.

___on_balance_sheet.description: Is the derivative reported on the balance sheet of the financial institution?

___purpose.description: The purpose for which the derivative is being held.

___source.description: The source(s) where this data originated. If more than one source needs to be stored for data lineage, it should be separated by a dash. eg. Source1-Source2

___underlying_derivative_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the underlying reference derivative for this derivative.

___start_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product commences. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___mna_id.description: The unique identifier of the Master Netting Agreement for this derivative cash flow.

___next_payment_date.description: The next date at which interest will be paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___id.description: The unique identifier for the derivative within the financial institution.

___underlying_security_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the underlying reference security for this derivative.

___prev_payment_date.description: The most recent previous date at which interest was paid or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___type.description: This is the type of the derivative with regards to common regulatory classifications.

___underlying_issuer_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution to identify the underlying reference issuer for this derivative.

___trade_date.description: The timestamp that the trade or financial product terms are agreed. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

$eref.description: Two-letter country code as defined according to ISO 3166-1 plus ISO allowed, user-assignable codes (AA, QM to QZ, XA to XZ, and ZZ).

___risk_country_code.description: Two-letter country code describing where the risk for the derivative product resides. In accordance with ISO 3166-1

$eref.description: The market identifier code as defined by the International Standards Organisation.

___next_receive_amount.description: The amount that is expected to be received at the next_receive_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___reporting_id.description: The internal ID for the legal entity under which the account is being reported.

___settlement_type.description: The type of settlement for the contract.

$eref.description: Currency in accordance with ISO 4217 standards plus CNH for practical considerations.

___currency_code.description: Actual currency of the underlying reference index, security or asset for the derivative in accordance with ISO 4217 standards. It should be consistent with balance, accrued_interest, guarantee_amount and other monetary amounts.

___receive_type.description: The type of the receive leg.

___ledger_code.description: The internal ledger code or line item name.

___theta.description: Price sensitivity with respect to time.

___mtm_clean.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative excluding interest. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___version_id.description: The version identifier of the data such as the firm's internal batch identifier.

___last_payment_date.description: The final payment date for interest payments, often coincides with end_date.

___value_date.description: The timestamp that the derivative was valued. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___mtm_dirty.description: The mark-to-market value of the derivative including interest. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

$eref.description: The accounting treatment in accordance with IAS/IFRS9 accounting principles.

___reporting_entity_name.description: The name of the reporting legal entity for display purposes.

___date.description: The observation or effective date for the data in this object. Formatted as YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ in accordance with ISO 8601.

___next_receive_date.description: The next date at which interest will be received or accrued_interest balance returned to zero.

___next_reset_date.description: The date on which the periodic payment term and conditions of a contract agreement are reset/re-established.

___first_payment_date.description: The first payment date for interest payments.

___accrued_interest.description: The accrued interest since the last payment date and due at the next payment date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___deal_id.description: The unique identifier used by the financial institution for the deal to which this derivative belongs.

___payment_type.description: The type of the payment leg.

___next_exercise_date.description: The next date at which the option can be exercised.

___next_payment_amount.description: The amount that will need to be paid at the next_payment_date. Monetary type represented as a naturally positive integer number of cents/pence.

___gamma.description: Second-order price sensitivity to the underlying or rate of change of the delta.
